blurb: How should we view nature and plan to protect it?
description: The biological sciences and education often highlight a dichotomy between addressing conservation biology scientifically and addressing it creatively.  However, this is unnecessary and hinders efforts in conservation biology.  Through the means of a “romantic teaching” education, both science and imagination can be employed so that efforts in conservation biology are understood and appreciated by scientists, politicians and the general public.
title: Once Upon a Time in Science: Imagination’s role in science
